news.title: Memory chip giants spark global semiconductor rally as shortages stoke price hikes
news.summary: Micron, SK Hynix and Samsung have led a rally in semiconductor stocks this year. Memory giants Micron and Samsung are among the top three semiconductor companies.

news.title: 'Greenland belongs to its people': European leaders unite over Trump’s threats to annex territory
news.summary: European leaders push back against U.S. President Donald Trump's renewed interest in Greenland. European leaders issue a joint statement to push back at Trump.

news.title: Software startup NinjaOne tops $500 million in annualized recurring revenue
news.summary: CapitalG-backed startup NinjaOne said it reached nearly 70% in year-over-year revenue growth. NinjaOne expects more in 2026.

news.title: Classified Venezuela briefing leaves lawmakers split along party lines after Maduro capture
news.summary: Senate Democrats are moving to force a vote on a measure to block further military action in Venezuela. Senate Democrats want to block any further military intervention in the country.

news.title: Iran unrest deepens as U.S. attack in Venezuela sharpens Trump intervention threat
news.summary: The unrest is fueled by a long-running economic crisis in Iran. At least 29 people have been killed and more than 1,200 have been arrested.

news.title: Bitcoin’s weakness is saying there will be a handoff to old-economy stocks, these market veterans say
news.summary: Some 2026 predictions from a handful of market veterans including Steve Eisman. Watch out for old economy stocks to shine this year, they say.

news.title: An AI tsunami is coming — U.S. workers need to prepare, because we can’t dodge it
news.summary: . 4 steps to strengthen training and skills so employees can meet AI head-on. 3 steps to train employees to meet AI face-to-face. 5 steps to help employees meet AI.

news.title: Why bonds now look like a better bet over stocks and gold
news.summary: Market-timers hate bonds — it’s time to consider buying them. The U.S. dollar is down against the euro and the yen.

news.title: ‘We track our finances religiously’: Are we obliged to pay for our daughter’s medical school? We have $2.6 million saved for retirement.
news.summary: “I am retired, and my wife is an employed physician,” he says. “She is 56 and would like to retire as well.”

news.title: ‘He even bragged about his Mercedes-Benz:’ I rejected two egotistical advisers. I managed my life savings and they tripled over 25 years. Did I do OK?
news.summary: "We do not take out-of-country or five-star vacations. Instead, we enjoy time with family and friends and hobbies," she says.
